activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J. Michalsen

records.addlTxt: from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

11:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew J. Michalsen in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing specially for Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Andrew J. Michalsen. Magallones states case is not resolved - would like to set out. Court will set for 1 day trial. adj. 11:08 AM
Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew J. Michalsen in court. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Andrew J. Michalsen. Victim appearing by video. Sowinski states case is resolved. Svehlek statement to Victim Impact Statement - will not be accepting the DEJ and would like to set for Jury Trial. Sowinski states DEJ is now not an option - can speak to victim again if she wishes. Bond continued. adj. 03:18 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew J. Michalsen in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Andrew J. Michalsen. Sowinski states parties are close to a resolution. Bond continued. adj. 11:34 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
09:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew J. Michalsen in court. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Svehlek/Sowinski statement to bond. Court modifies bond conditions. adj. 09:10 am
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
No contact with victim/No intoxicants/No taverns

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew J. Michalsen appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video, will be representing. Defendant in receipt of complaint. Svehlek waives reading - set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. Sowinski/Victim statement to bail. Defendant statement to employment. Court sets bond. adj. 01:36 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
